intro: Lithocardium sericicalyx, commonly known as the silky-leaf lithocardium, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, often arranged in clusters. The plant has a woody stem and produces elliptical, leathery leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Lithocardium sericicalyx is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, making it a typical component of the local flora in its native range.
